solution_line_template: Ted needs {num_bananas} bananas and they each cost ${cost_per_banana}. To purchase the bananas, Ted needs {num_bananas}*{cost_per_banana}= <<{num_bananas}*{cost_per_banana}={cost_bananas}>>{cost_bananas} dollars

Because Ted needs {num_oranges} oranges and they each cost ${cost_per_orange}, Ted needs {num_oranges}*{cost_per_orange}= <<{num_oranges}*{cost_per_orange}={cost_oranges}>>{cost_oranges} dollars to pay for the oranges.

All together Ted needs ${cost_bananas} for the bananas and ${cost_oranges} for the oranges, so combined Ted needs {cost_bananas}+{cost_oranges}= <<{cost_bananas}+{cost_oranges}={total_cost}>>{total_cost} dollars to purchase all the produce.
